category: Elements of a Traditional Classical Orchestra Performance
explanation: Conductor, Baton, Score, and Stand are all integral components or tools directly involved in the live acoustic performance and direction of a traditional classical orchestra. A Microphone is primarily used for amplification or recording, which is not an inherent or traditional part of the internal performance mechanism of such an ensemble.
Hieroglyphs, Cuneiform, Quipu, and Linear B are all distinct ancient systems for writing or record-keeping. Parchment, on the other hand, is a material used for writing, not a system itself.

category: Adjectives derived from celestial bodies that are planets
explanation: Saturnine (Saturn), Martial (Mars), Jovial (Jupiter), and Mercurial (Mercury) are all adjectives derived from the names of planets. Lunar is derived from Luna (the Moon), which is not a planet.
